bio.introduction: I am a Machine Learning graduate student at CMU, working under Professor Aarti Singh (NSF AI-SDM). My research focuses on AI-driven decision-making, cognitive alignment, and multimodal systems.
bio.background: Previously, I worked at Wells Fargo as a machine learning engineer, and I received my bachelor's in electrical engineering with a minor in AI from Netaji Subhas University of Technology.
bio.researchFocus: My research lies at the intersection of AI-driven decision-making, cognitive alignment, and healthcare applications. I design frameworks that bridge the gap between how humans think and how AI reasons, ensuring models are not only accurate but also psychologically aligned and trustworthy.

publications.title: Mind the Gap: Bridging AI-Human Cognitive Misalignment Through Psychological Personas
publications.description: This addresses the critical challenge of AI-human cognitive misalignment by developing psychological personas that bridge the gap between artificial intelligence systems and human cognitive processes.

publications.title: Contextual Bandits with Online Arm Generation
publications.description: Explores contextual bandits with online arm generation, presenting novel approaches to dynamic decision-making in machine learning systems.

publications.title: Ambient Intelligence-based multimodal human action recognition for autonomous systems
publications.description: Presents a method based on Bi-Convolutional Recurrent Neural Network (Bi-CRNN)-based Feature Extraction and Random Forest classification for human action recognition in autonomous robots.

publications.title: Maternal Health Agent
publications.description: Designed safety-critical RAG pipelines with HNSW indexing, hybrid semantic chunking, and multi-stage reranking, achieving +18% retrieval relevance and â€“25% latency using vLLM. Integrated emergency-aware reasoning framework with symptom triage, intent classification, and medical guardrails with knowledge distillation of open-source LLMs (med-alpacca, llama).

publications.title: Explainability Analysis on Human Perception Models
publications.description: Created CNN-based visual perception models, leveraging activation maximization, class model visualization, integrated gradients, and saliency maps to enhance explainability. Applied Transformer models (Vision Transformer, Perceiver IO) for multisensory human perception, utilizing model-agnostic techniques (SHAP, LIME, Captum) and attention rollout to improve interpretability.

publications.title: Multiscale Kernels for Identifying Systematic Behavior Patterns
publications.description: Developed a method for identifying systematic behavior in data analysis by transforming raw accelerometer and gyroscope data using multi-scale CNN layers. Captures stationary and non-stationary features across time windows for improved behavior pattern recognition.

projects.title: Neurascribe
projects.shortDescription: A voice-to-voice knowledge graph-based journaling-wellness platform that integrates memory weaving and episodic memory recall
projects.detailedDescription: A voice-to-voice journaling-wellness platform that integrates memory weaving and episodic memory recall, leveraging hybrid retrieval from vector embeddings (Pinecone) and knowledge graphs, reducing latency by 40% using vLLMs. Implemented multi-stage reranking pipeline with emotional inference and fine-tuned LLMs using LoRA adaptation.

projects.title: Cognitive Multimodal Speech Recognition
projects.shortDescription: Multimodal lip-reading + self-supervised audio with knowledge distillation.
projects.detailedDescription: Built multimodal pipeline combining vision (Transformer lip-reading, ViT-B/16) and self-supervised audio (HuBERT, wav2vec 2.0). Applied knowledge distillation to compress large multimodal models, reducing size by 60% with minimal WER/CER drop.

projects.title: Needle
projects.shortDescription: A full-stack deep learning library from scratch with Cuda-accelerated operations and automatic differentiation.
projects.detailedDescription: Designed and implemented a full-stack deep learning library from scratch with Cuda-accelerated operations and automatic differentiation. Developed modular components, including parameterized layers, loss functions, optimizers, and data loaders. Built state-of-the-art models: CNNs, RNNs, and Transformers for tasks such as image classification and language modeling.

projects.title: Hybrid Attention Multi-modal Learning for Perceived Mental Workload Classification
projects.shortDescription: Hybrid attention fusion across modalities for workload prediction.
projects.detailedDescription: The project is based on the applicability of the brain-computer interface using multimodal biosignals and attention networks for quantifying cognitive load in well-validated problem-solving tasks. The proposed approach firstly models each modality through LSTM and Convolution based self-attention. Then it applies bi-modal attention to pairwise modalities and tries to learn the contributing features amongst them. It gives an accuracy of 92.3%.

projects.title: Agri AI
projects.shortDescription: Intelligent crop monitoring system using computer vision and ML to predict yields, detect diseases, and optimize farming practices.
projects.detailedDescription: Deployed an end-to-end web application to assist farmers in administering their crop quality, suggesting crop price, and predicting the yield taking into account the soil and crop type, all by the comfort of a click of a button. Used CatBoost Classifier, Gaussian NaÃ¯ve Bayes Model, MobileNet, Random Forest Regressor, and Deep bidirectional LSTM Models one for each feature in the project. The aggregate accuracy achieved by the 5 Models is 91%.

projects.title: Covi Home Bot
projects.shortDescription: Home triage assistant for COVID-era symptom checks and resources.
projects.detailedDescription: AI-powered chatbot providing real-time COVID-19 symptom assessment, resource recommendations, and emergency guidance during the pandemic.
